title.narrative: Aquifer storage and recovery techniques for sustainable banana production in the Magdalena region, Colombia

description.narrative: The project aims to steer the preparation and execution of a feasibility study and cost-benefit analysis to improve water management techniques of banana and plantain medium size producers in the Magdalena region in Colombia, with a focus on the potential for aquifer recharge and recovery techniques. The project will investigate and address the limiting factors for the adaptation of integrated innovative water related practices, with a focus on sustainable aquifer use and groundwater recharge techniques. It will provide concrete recommendations of methods and techniques to improve water management through ground water recharge methods (vertical and horizontal infiltration), and the inclusion of various irrigation technologies to optimize water efficiency (surface and subsurface). By using smart irrigation and providing the banana fields with technologies like ground water recharge techniques their use of and dependency on surface water in the dry season will be reduced. The introduction of these techniques will contribute to anticipating possible changes of international certification standards including new requirements on good water practices for bananas production, maintaining export markets and, therefore, guaranteeing in turn a more stable and fair income.This project aims to investigate opportunities for aquifer storage and recovery, e.g. of excess of water during rainy periods to be used in times of water scarcity, and as such, to reduce the dependency of the banana (and plantain) plantations on fresh surface water
